main_definition: Quarters refers to a portion or part of something that is divided into four equal parts, commonly used in the context of time (specifically hours) and money (a specific monetary unit). It can also refer to groups of people under military command.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Division of something into four equal parts
meanings_and_examples.example: The cake was cut into quarters for the party.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Each of the four one-hour periods in a day (1:00 PM to 4:00 PM)
meanings_and_examples.example: I have my morning classes from 8:00 AM until noon, and then I take quarters until 5:00 PM.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A quarter of a dollar (25 cents in United States currency)
meanings_and_examples.example: She gave me a quarter for parking the car on the street.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Groups of soldiers or officers under command
meanings_and_examples.example: The captain led his troops into battle, dividing them into quarters for strategic purposes.
